body.p:
Lexington July 5/64
Honr T E Bramlet
Resp Friend

You will do A faveur to A Worthy And Loyal Man my friend Joseph B Cooper A Clerk At Camp Nelson to Appoint him A Notary Publik for of that place he is well qualified to fill the office And I am enformed it is An Office that is much Needed that At this time And he is A Clerk in the Quarter Masters Department there And it is thought Ab he very emportant to
A Notary thare to transact Government Business And to oblige the Publick
I hope you will be so good As to send Mr. Cooper A Commission to this place for the office And you will oblige your friend And
P S I hope you can send it to him by return male he is An old citizen of this place And worthy of the appointment

As I dont suppose that you will be able to decypher Uncle Davy's letter, I will say that it is a recommendation for the appointing of Joseph B Cooper a clerk at Camp Nelson Jessamine County, Notary Public. There is no Notary here and one constantly needed. I have long known Mr. Cooper and heartely join in the recommendation.

Jessamine Co
Notary Public
J B Cooper
Apptd.
6th July/64
